result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Pay DNA surcharge.
Pay court ordered financial obligations and supervision fees.
Complete specific programming determined by the Department of Corrections.
Comply with all provisions of probation.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: from S/W DOC re: requesting the Court review the amended JOC, believes the term of confinement in prison may not exceed one year and 6 months.
Partial Transcript Sentencing Hearing.

from S/W DOC re: requesting Court review JOC's. Believes the confinement does not meet the statutory requirements per Wis. Stats. 973.01(2)(b)9 which states that, "for a Class I felony, the term of confinement in prison my not exceed one year and 6 months".
from S/W DOC re: requesting the Court review the JOC's. Believes the Court granted more jail credit than allowed per WIS Stats. 973.155(1)

records.addlTxt: 2:48 Defendant Jose A Sanchez in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Jose A Sanchez in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF217, 15CF218,15CF227 and 15CF231 heard at this time. Neither attorney has any changes. OSullivan asks for 4 years incarceration and 4 years ES. Atty Petros agrees with the PSI recommendations.  10 month jail time on each case concurrent.  Court addresses sentencing factors. Addresses course of conduct and seriousness of the offense. Court: 15CF60 3.5 years= 2 year initial confinement and  1.6 months ES, 15CF217 both counts: 4 years total: 2 years initial confinement, 2 years ES, concurrent to 15CF60. 15CF227 4 years total= 2 years initial confinement and 2 years ES. 15CF218- Ct#1 3.5 years total: 2 years initial confinement and 1 year 6 months ES -- Ct #2 4 years= 2  years initial confinement and 2 years ES. 15CF231 Ct#2  3.6: 2 years initial confinement. and 1.5 years ES. Ct#3 4 years: 2 years initial confinemant, 2 years ES.  Conditions of ES are as listed on PSI. DNA Sample 15CF60 and surcharge.  All sentences are concurrent with each other. Eligible for challenge incarceration and Drug.  8 months 18 days credit on each case.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan requests the trial be continued due to his attending conference.  Court grants the motion to continue. Atty Petros addresses the bond on all cases. OSullivan opposes lowering the cash bond. Court modifies the cash bond in 15CF231 to $500.00 cash with the condition of   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs as well as any other conditions that were on the previous bond.
State's
for Continuance filed by Atty OSullivan

10:17 Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez in court, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF217, 15CF218, 15CF227, 15CF231, 15CM56, 15CT140, 15CT143, 15TR1418 heard at this time. Def is trying to fire his 2nd public defender. Court: will not release Atty Petros until Def has another attorney or willing to waive his right to have an attorney. Def stated he has not been given his discovery. Atty Petros responds to this. Atty OSullivan states discovery was sent to Defendant's 1st attorney of record. Court urges Def to give Atty Petros another change. Get discovery exchange and get these cases back on track.
from JA Feuerhelm to Def re: Judge reviewed Petition for Appointment of Counsel, but is not allowing Atty Petros to be released. Scheduling Conference scheduled to address.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order and a letter to the Judge signed by Def
Status conference at 02-02-2016 10:15 am.

from Wisconsin State Public Defenders Office to Defendant re: receipt of his request asking Atty Petros to be discharged from cases. Policy allows one reassignment. Defendant will need to write the Court and ask for a Court order.
Criminal Jury Trial Scheduling Order

Final pre-trial at 03-14-2016 02:45 pm.

4:21  This includes 15CM56, 15CT140, 15CT143, 15CF217, 15CF218, 15CF231Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No agreement on this case all of these cases will be tried one right after another. Will be put on trial calendar.

4:24  This includes 15CM56, 15CT140, 15CT143, 15CF217, 15CF218, 15CF231  Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Petros requests a bond reduction.  OSullivan objects to the bond reduction on the cash bond.   Bond modification is denied.

Petros moves the order for a modification of bond. OSullivan moves to amend the name on each file to be just Jose Antonio Sanchez. Does not object to oral motion to amend cash bond on 15CF231 and objects to modification of cash bond on that file. Addresses bail jumping and new charges.  Court states bond is going to remain in it's current form on each case.
Def pleas not guilty to all charges in all 4 cases. OSullivan and Petros agree to any motion to be filed within 20 days.

3:10 Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF218, 15CF227 and 15CF231 heard at this time.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court binds the def over for further proceedings. OSullivan files an information in all 4 cases; Def has received a copy. Def waives reading.

Hearing at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 3:45 Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez-De Anda in court, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin via phone. Atty Lars Loberg appears in court for the Public Defender's Office.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullivan: $1000 cash bond. Loberg requests signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
